#Text=US Army sergeant asserts Posse Comitatus is not being violated
#Text=Tuesday , October 14 , 2008

#Text=Wikinews recently published an article which explained that NorthComm , through an Executive Order of the President of the United States , directed the 3rd Infantry Division 's 1st Brigade Combat Team to return to the United States from active duty missions in Iraq to begin training in a new role .

#Text=NorthComm says that these troops will be used to protect the United States from threats within the United States , as well as to provide a support role to local and state agencies during times of emergency , such as with Hurricane Katrina .

#Text=Critics , however , believe that moving an active military unit back to United States soil represents a violation of the Posse Comitatus Act of 1878 , which makes it illegal for federal military resources to act as law enforcement agencies against civilians .
#Text=The article included citations from critic Namoi Watts , who based part of her opinion on an interview with retired U.S. Air Force Colonel David Antoon .
#Text=Ret. Col. Antoon stated that a military coup was already under way through the actions of NorthComm , and that other branches of the government would be powerless .
#Text=Wikinews reporter Kevin Fields had an opportunity to speak with an active duty member of the United States Army , a sergeant who is currently deployed to a peace keeping mission in Iraq .
#Text=Federal laws officially prevents him from giving making any statement on military policy , however he agreed to do so on the condition of anonymity .
#Text=The initials used here are not his initials of his name , only used as a pseudonym .

#Text=Sgt. P.S.N. was asked to review a source article from the Army Times website which provided the original breaking information , and to provide his opinions on the article as well as follow-up questions .
#Text=Kevin Fields : In summary , what do you believe is happening here , from a military standpoint ?
#Text=Sgt. P.S.N.
#Text=: As far as I can tell , they wo n't be in charge of law enforcement , so no , this is not a violation of Posse Comitatus .
#Text=As far as crowd control and disaster relief are concerned , that 's certainly not without precedent .
#Text=Kevin Fields : Right , but before they 've always been under the control of state officials , such as a governor or local law enforcement , correct ?
#Text=Sgt. P.S.N.
#Text=: The National Guard was called into Little Rock in 1957 to prevent black students from enrolling in Central High School as per Brown v Board .
#Text=Eisenhower called in the 82nd Airborne , federalized the Arkansas National Guard , and ordered them to escort the students into the school .
#Text=They hung around for months afterward to keep the peace .
#Text=The military was used to quell the Watts riots in South Central L.A. in the 1960s , and again in the aftermath of the Rodney King trial in 1991 .
#Text=In the cases where NorthComm is called to provide troops from the 1st BCT of the 3rd ID , they will still be used at the discretion of the local officials .
#Text=Kevin Fields : So it is possible that the President can assign federal troops to act in law enforcement officials , and it NOT violate Posse Comitatus ?
#Text=Or would such a case clearly violate it , but nothing can be done about it ?
#Text=Sgt. P.S.N.
#Text=: No , the president cannot order them to act as law enforcement .
#Text=He can order them to defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies , foreign AND domestic .
#Text=Kevin Fields : What would be the difference ?
#Text=Sgt. P.S.N.
#Text=: You 're not going to see Humvees patrolling your city streets , writing tickets , and arresting shoplifters , wife beaters , or even rapists and murderers .
#Text=You will see them stop rioting , looting , violent demonstrations , and the like if the local law enforcement does not possess the ability to do so .
#Text=They wo n't be involved without either a request from local officials or a determination by DHS or FEMA that such involvement is necessary .
#Text=Kevin Fields : Critics have suggested that this is part of a strategy to usurp power and consolidate it in the Presidency .
#Text=Is it possible for a President of the United States to stage a coup by deploying the CCMRF and NorthComm to permanently take over an area where there is rioting or a national disaster ?
#Text=Sgt. P.S.N.
#Text=: No.
#Text=For one thing , Congressional oversight prevents this .
#Text=For another , I 'm quite certain the Supreme Court would claim original jurisdiction in a case such as that .
#Text=This is one reason presidents are limited to two terms .
#Text=Kevin Fields : So even though this unit , and NorthComm , are under the direct command of the President , Congress can still stop his actions ?
#Text=Sgt. P.S.N.
#Text=: They can call for hearings to examine his actions .
#Text=Congress is who impeaches and ultimately removes the President from office if he usurps his authority .
#Text=HAVE YOUR SAY Would you expect on-the-ground commanders to ignore executive orders if they overstepped the granted authority ?
#Text=Add or view comments
#Text=Kevin Fields : Critics say that such hearings would not be swift , and that such action would not directly affect the President or any action he takes through this unit .
#Text=Would you agree with that ?
#Text=Sgt. P.S.N.
#Text=: The only mandate NorthComm has is to provide support to Homeland Security operations , so no .

#Text=The three things I 'd ask you to remember are these : First , there is precedence dating back nearly to the beginning of this nation 's history for using the military in times of national emergency or cataclysmic disaster .

#Text=Second , when there are cases where the citizens of an area have overpowered the police , such as in New Orleans during Katrina or the aforementioned riots in L.A. , the military 's mandate to defend the U.S. against domestic enemies is pretty much a no-brainier at that point .
#Text=Third , who else is training to handle mass casualty situations such as dirty bombs , 9/11 type of events , or mass poisoning epidemics ?
#Text=These are things that the United States military are trained to handle that relatively few other agencies are equipped or funded to handle .
#Text=The whole point of NorthComm is so that the military is better organized and better able to respond on short notice than we were after Katrina .
#Text=Kevin Fields :
#Text=Thank you for your input into this story .
